Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: The Nazi War Machine of WWII

programme.title: Fight to Survive
programme.desc: Faith, determination and human spirit abound in "Fight to Survive," which recounts stories of people's deadly ordeals in the outdoors. Accompanying survivors back to where harrowing events occurred is rock-climber Craig DeMartino, who is featured in the premiere episode. His right leg was amputated below the knee after a climbing accident, but he continued in his sport. In 2006 he became the first amputee to free-climb the 3,200-foot face of Yosemite's El Capitan in one day. Other stories tell of sailor Steven Callahan clinging to a raft in the Atlantic, fisherman Dean Ririe trapped by a boulder in icy water, and hiker Ted Porter falling into a glacial crevasse.

His right leg was amputated below the knee after a climbing accident, but he continued in his sport. In 2006 he became the first amputee to free-climb the 3,200-foot face of Yosemite's El Capitan in one day. Other stories tell of sailor Steven Callahan clinging to a raft in the Atlantic, fisherman Dean Ririe trapped by a boulder in icy water, and hiker Ted Porter falling into a glacial crevasse.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes connects a missing teacher and a past mystery when a duke's son is kidnapped.

programme.title: The Arizona Kid
programme.desc: Roy gallops into a skirmish with renegade soldiers who are terrorizing the Southwest during the Civil War.

programme.title: West Side Story
programme.desc: A musical in which a modern day Romeo and Juliet are involved in New York street gangs. On the harsh streets of the upper west side, two gangs battle for control of the turf. The situation becomes complicated when a gang members falls in love with a rival's sister.

programme.title: Cash McCall
programme.desc: Wealthy hotshot Cash McCall (James Garner) makes his money by purchasing unsuccessful businesses, whipping them into shape and then selling them for a huge profit. When Cash comes across Austen Plastics, a small manufacturing corporation on its last legs, he realizes it might be a gamble to buy the company. But when Cash finds out that the company's owner, Grant (Dean Jagger), is the father of his old flame, Lory (Natalie Wood), he buys the business just to get a second chance at romance.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Calamity Jane
programme.desc: In the lonely Deadwood, Dakota, territory, sharpshooter Calamity Jane (Doris Day) falls for cavalry Lt. Danny Gilmartin (Philip Carey) when she is forced to rescue him from the Indians. Recognizing that the women-starved townsmen long for a "real" woman, Calamity journeys to Chicago to bring back famous singer Adelaid Adams, but mistakenly brings her maid Katie instead. Heartbroken when Danny falls for Katie, Calamity all but ignores her jovial friend Wild Bill Hickok (Howard Keel).

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Gidget Goes Hawaiian
programme.desc: In this sequel to the hit 1959 film "Gidget," Francie "Gidget" Lawrence (Deborah Walley) is once again involved with her boyfriend, Jeff "Moondoggie" Matthews (James Darren). However, they have a lovers' spat, and Gidget goes to sulk in Hawaii with her parents. In the islands, she meets TV dancer Eddie Horner (Michael Callan). Seeing how miserable she's become, Gidget's wise dad (Carl Reiner) sends for Moondoggie, and the couple reunite just as Gidget gets romantic with Eddie.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: The head (Charlton Heston) of a Hawaiian pineapple dynasty refuses to let his sister (Yvette Mimieux) marry a native.

programme.title: Rancho Notorious
programme.desc: Vern Haskell (Arthur Kennedy) is pushed to revenge when his fiancée is killed during a general store robbery. Intent on punishing those responsible, Vern manages to find one of the thieves, who is mortally wounded. In his dying words, the man gives Vern a clue to finding the others. Continuing his quest, Vern travels to the hideout -- a ranch operated by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich), a former saloon singer. By fooling an outlaw (Mel Ferrer), Vern makes his way into their inner circle.

programme.title: The Champion
programme.desc: Charlie (Charles Chaplin) wins boxing matches by placing a horseshoe in his glove.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Watson's encounter with Lady Frances Carfax brings Holmes rushing to the Lake District.

programme.title: Life Outreach Mission Feeding
programme.desc: The hosts shed light on an initiative by a Christian organisation to fulfil the nutritional needs of malnourished children across Africa.

programme.title: The Fatal Mallet
programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Shriner's Hospital for Children Stories of Love
Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A pair of crooks plans to rob the Cannonball of its bank shipment.

programme.title: Gidget Goes Hawaiian
programme.desc: In this sequel to the hit 1959 film "Gidget," Francie "Gidget" Lawrence (Deborah Walley) is once again involved with her boyfriend, Jeff "Moondoggie" Matthews (James Darren). programme.title: The Range Feud

Continuing his quest, Vern travels to the hideout -- a ranch operated by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich), a former saloon singer. By fooling an outlaw (Mel Ferrer), Vern makes his way into their inner circle.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Backlash
programme.desc: Jim Slater (Richard Widmark) never knew his father, who died in an Apache ambush in Arizona. After hearing that someone may have survived the ambush and escaped with a stash of gold, Slater sets out to discover exactly what happened. Along the way, he meets Karyl Orton (Donna Reed), widow of one the men killed in the ambush, and attracts the unwanted attention of local hotshot Johnny Cool (William Campbell). A chance encounter offers answers, but Slater isn't so sure he wants to know anymore.

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: During the 1820s, a domineering young minister, Abner Hale (Max von Sydow), and his compassionate wife, Jerusha (Julie Andrews), embark on a dangerous sea voyage to Hawaii. When they arrive, Jerusha befriends the Hawaiian people and embraces their customs and culture, while Abner, intent on converting them to Christianity, views them as pagan savages. Jerusha grows unhappy with her marriage and begins to fall for Rafer Hoxworth (Richard Harris), a past lover.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Cyclone Fury
programme.desc: The Durango Kid puts the skids on a bandit bent on sabotaging an Indian's bid for a government contract.

programme.title: Sagebrush Trail
programme.desc: Wrongly imprisoned for murder, John Brant (John Wayne) decides his only option is to escape from jail and clear his name by finding the true killer. After breaking out, he ends up on the run from Sheriff Parker (Bob Burns) and catches the attention of outlaw Bob Jones (Lane Chandler), who offers to let Brant into his gang. Needing all the help he can get, Brant agrees, but running with these bandits only gets him deeper into trouble -- while the real killer remains on the loose.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Maria Gibson arranges to meet her children's governess at Thor Bridge, but is gunned down. The young governess is accused of murder, which forces her employer to enlist the aid of Sherlock Holmes.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and Pancho track an outlaw responsible for a series of stagecoach robberies and masquerading as the Kid.

programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

When they arrive, Jerusha befriends the Hawaiian people and embraces their customs and culture, while Abner, intent on converting them to Christianity, views them as pagan savages. Jerusha grows unhappy with her marriage and begins to fall for Rafer Hoxworth (Richard Harris), a past lover.

programme.title: The Tall Texan
programme.desc: Sheriff Chadbourne (Samuel Herrick) transports convict Ben Trask (Lloyd Bridges) to El Paso in a covered wagon. The wagon also carries sea captain Theodore Bess (Lee J. Cobb) and married couple Laura (Marie Windsor) and Jerry Niblett (Dean Train). The group comes upon a wounded Native American, banished by his tribe, who offers to lead them to gold. But then the tribe attacks the wagon, killing Jerry and wounding Chadbourne. Ben is freed to help, but the group's troubles have only begun.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Backlash
programme.desc: Jim Slater (Richard Widmark) never knew his father, who died in an Apache ambush in Arizona. After hearing that someone may have survived the ambush and escaped with a stash of gold, Slater sets out to discover exactly what happened. Along the way, he meets Karyl Orton (Donna Reed), widow of one the men killed in the ambush, and attracts the unwanted attention of local hotshot Johnny Cool (William Campbell). A chance encounter offers answers, but Slater isn't so sure he wants to know anymore.

programme.title: Badman's Territory
programme.desc: After Jesse and Frank James rob a bank in a northern Texas country, Sheriff Mark Rowley (Randolph Scott) and his deputy brother Johnny (James Warren) pursue them into the "Badlands" territory, an outlaw haven not associated with any government. The James brothers are also wanted by a devious federal marshal, who battles Mark for their custody. Soon Mark and Johnny are embroiled with the Dalton Gang and an effort by a female newspaper owner (Ann Richards) to make the territory part of Oklahoma.

programme.title: Charro!
programme.desc: A reformed outlaw's (Elvis Presley) old gang tries to frame him for the theft of a jeweled Mexican cannon.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. When he arrives in a small town near the robbery, he senses that the thieves may be living there. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
programme.desc: The life of celebrated American writer Harry Street (Gregory Peck) flashes back before his eyes as he lies dying from a wound suffered at the foot of Tanzania's Mount Kilimanjaro. As he is tended to by his traveling companion, Helen (Susan Hayward), he recalls many things: his first wife and Paris literary inspiration, Cynthia Green (Ava Gardner) ; his second wife, Countess Liz (Hildegarde Neff) ; and his formative years with uncle Bill (Leo G. Carroll).

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes is consulted by a man who is concerned about the sudden strange behavior of his employer, who has taken to visiting a ruined crypt at nighttime, and bones are later discovered in his furnace.

programme.title: Life Outreach Mission Feeding
programme.desc: The hosts shed light on an initiative by a Christian organisation to fulfil the nutritional needs of malnourished children across Africa.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid Returns
programme.desc: Pancho and the Kid attempt to prove that they did not kidnap the child they are protecting from a killer.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: The Dry Gulch Gang ambushes Earp's Cheyenne agents, killing Mr. Brother; a vengeful Earp stalks the men and confronts one when the killer comes to Dodge City to finish the job on a severely wounded Mr. Cousin.

programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project featuring Trace Adkins
The Snows of Kilimanjaro
programme.desc: The life of celebrated American writer Harry Street (Gregory Peck) flashes back before his eyes as he lies dying from a wound suffered at the foot of Tanzania's Mount Kilimanjaro. As he is tended to by his traveling companion, Helen (Susan Hayward), he recalls many things: his first wife and Paris literary inspiration, Cynthia Green (Ava Gardner) ; his second wife, Countess Liz (Hildegarde Neff) ; and his formative years with uncle Bill (Leo G. Carroll).

programme.title: Hellgate
programme.desc: After the Civil War, ranch owner Gil Hanley helps a stranger in desperate need of medical attention. Soon he is questioned by Union soldiers about the stranger, who turns out to be an ex-Confederate soldier. Hanley, also an ex-Confederate, is unjustly convicted as a conspirator and sentenced to life in a brutal desert prison in New Mexico. After battling his tough cellmate and a sadistic guard, Hanley tries to stop a plague from overwhelming the prison.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Charro!
programme.desc: A reformed outlaw's (Elvis Presley) old gang tries to frame him for the theft of a jeweled Mexican cannon.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. When he arrives in a small town near the robbery, he senses that the thieves may be living there. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The luck of Pat Brennan (Randolph Scott) is about to go from bad to worse; after gambling his horse away, he gets a ride from Willard (John Hubbard) and Doretta Mims (Maureen O'Sullivan). Soon, their stagecoach is hijacked by a trio of merciless bandits, led by the especially heartless Frank Usher (Richard Boone). As Usher holds the coach passengers hostage, Brennan falls in love with Doretta and develops a risky plan to free himself and the Mimses, leading to a bloody final standoff.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Cheyenne Autumn
programme.desc: Large-scale frontier epic telling the true story of a band of Cheyenne Indians who, starved nearly to extinction on an inhospitable reservation, embark on the long trek back to their distant ancestral homelands in Wyoming, despite opposition from the US Army. Their journey revives old hatreds - and the threat of war.

programme.title: Kit Carson
programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The detective tries to clear a man accused of patricide.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A lovesick artist asks Earp to help him learn to fight when his fiancée's family tries to run him out of town; Earp refuses but an impressed Doc Holliday decides to try helping the man instead.

programme.title: Rimfire
programme.desc: An undercover Army captain (James Millican) links missing gold and murder to a gambler's (Reed Hadley) ghost.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Car Repair Secrets!
programme.desc: Save thousands on car repairs.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Homer returns to Shady Rest in an attempt to scrap the Cannonball.

programme.title: Buckskin Frontier
programme.desc: Railroad surveyor Stephen Bent (Richard Dix) tangles with freight company owner Jeptha Marr (Lee J. Cobb), who fears the coming railroad will bankrupt his business. With the help of Marr's sympathetic daughter, Vinnie (Jane Wyatt), Stephen gets Marr's assistant, Gideon (Albert Dekker), on his side. But, when a rival railroad's representative (Victor Jory) implies that Stephen is having an affair with investor Rita Molyneaux (Lola Lane), it threatens everything Stephen has worked for.

programme.title: Cheyenne Autumn
programme.desc: Large-scale frontier epic telling the true story of a band of Cheyenne Indians who, starved nearly to extinction on an inhospitable reservation, embark on the long trek back to their distant ancestral homelands in Wyoming, despite opposition from the US Army. Their journey revives old hatreds - and the threat of war.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The luck of Pat Brennan (Randolph Scott) is about to go from bad to worse; after gambling his horse away, he gets a ride from Willard (John Hubbard) and Doretta Mims (Maureen O'Sullivan). Soon, their stagecoach is hijacked by a trio of merciless bandits, led by the especially heartless Frank Usher (Richard Boone). programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Firecreek
programme.desc: Johnny Cobb (James Stewart) is the part-time sheriff in a small, rundown town, trying to stretch his meager salary to provide for his growing family. Poor Cobb isn't much of a gunman, and he isn't particularly suited for fighting, but he's the man in charge when a gang of bandits led by Bob Larkin (Henry Fonda) rides into town. The tension rises as the bandits make themselves at home in Cobb's town, but when a gunfight breaks out, Cobb finds himself pushed to the limit.

programme.title: Big Jim McLain
programme.desc: Jim McLain (John Wayne) and his partner, Mal Baxter (James Arness), are investigators for the House Un-American Activities Committee, who are sent to Hawaii to find the leaders of a local Communist Party. They visit Dr. Gelster (Gayne Whitman), a psychiatrist who is treating one of the party members. While there, McLain charms the doctor's secretary, Nancy Vallon (Nancy Olson), and asks her out. As their hunt continues, McLain and Baxter become targets of Communist boss Sturak (Alan Napier).

programme.title: The Scarlet and the Black
programme.desc: Defying a Nazi colonel (Christopher Plummer), Vatican Monsignor Hugh O'Flaherty (Gregory Peck) hides thousands of escaped POWs in occupied Rome.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Tensions build when a gunman taunts the new husband of a former river-boat girl.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Outlaw Belle Starr and her gang rob a train on which Jim Hardie is a passenger, and he tries to lure her from hiding by tempting her with a prominent racehorse.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: A rookie outlaw holds up the stage carrying cash that Jim is waiting for, prompting Jim to go off looking for the thief, but he finds he needs the criminal's help when the two must evade an Indian attack.

programme.desc: Outlaws who rob and then kill a wealthy rancher find their escape is slowed when their booty -- weighty gold coins -- becomes difficult to transport.

programme.title: Cheyenne

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark tries to play Cupid for his father and a pretty young stranger who arrives in town.

programme.desc: A widow (Geraldine Brooks) whose husband once owned the High Chaparral hires a gunfighter to drive off the Cannons.

programme.desc: Neighbors victimize a rancher with their cattle, but the conflict leads to murder.

programme.desc: The town drunk thinks that he dreamed about a murder, but later sees the killer.

programme.desc: As the only witness to a robbery, Hardie is targeted by the robber's partner.

programme.desc: Jess catches a man in the freight office who he thinks is casing the place for the Logan gang, though he has no proof.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: In search of his partner's slayer, Cheyenne learns a dead man held the secret to another murder and a large inheritance.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: The Virginian defends a poor homesteader (Jack Warden) against attacks by Judge Garth and an ex-Army officer (John Anderson); guest Ted Knight.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Tensions build when a gunman taunts the new husband of a former river-boat girl.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Mac Traven (Tom Selleck) is a Civil War veteran who fought for the North, while his brother, Dal (Sam Elliott), was allied with the South. In spite of this considerable point of contention, the siblings must work together when they find that other family members have been abducted, along with Dal's girlfriend, Kate (Katharine Ross). Joined by their trouble-making uncle "Black Jack" (Ben Johnson), Mac and Dal relentlessly pursue the criminals to rescue their relatives.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: A fugitive risks capture to see a youth who once helped him.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: A trouble-plagued homesteader (Dan Duryea) acquires more problems when Trampas, suspected of murder and suffering from amnesia, stumbles onto the farm seeking refuge; guests Michael Burns, Ed Peck.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: When a card shark receives a letter from a distant and troubled son, he travels to rescue the boy and his mother. During a train ride, the gambler meets a friendly, prideful young card player and shares his wisdom.

programme.title: The Big Trees
programme.desc: A timber baron plans to take advantage of a new law and make millions. Making his money turns out to be harder than he ever thought when the Quakers who own the land refuse to sell their precious trees.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E8 Aged to Perfection The guys saddle up to rope in a renegade heifer before she tears up a neighbor's field. Booger creates a birthday to remember for his 85-year-old grandma, including her first ride in a convertible, a photo shoot and a huge surprise party with a special guest. Cody goes on a personal publicity tour to promote the opening of their pop-up restaurant. On the eve of their big opening, the neglected details could turn the cowboys' restaurant dream into a nightmare. Bubba forgets a key ingredient, Cody's efforts bring in an unexpected number of hungry customers, and they run out of their signature steak. It's a night to make the guys wonder if they'd be better off just sticking to The Cowboy Way of life they love.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: It's a rope-swinging episode of The Cowboy Way! After their restaurant venture, each of the cowboys takes some quality time to reconnect with family and discuss their futures. Cody decides to make the ranch high-tech, but will it be a success or will he get his wires crossed? Bubba plays locksmith for Booger's truck. A missing cow gets stuck in the woods. The guys use Booger's annual horse clinic as a way to give back to the community. And get ready for matchmaking the cowboy way! When the boys set up a mixer for bachelors Frankie and Hodge, speed-dating turns into a literal horse race to win the ladies' affections.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: They Call Me Trinity
programme.desc: When a land-hungry rancher sends his bullies to harass peace-loving Mormons into giving up their fertile valley, a lazy gunfighter with a very quick draw and amazing accuracy, along with his horse-thieving brother, come to the settlers' rescue.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E14 Big Ghost Basin Cheyenne finds a dead man's body and strange signs from the mysterious killer on a trail to Crowheart. When he arrives in town with the body, the townspeople suspect him to be a member of the rustler gang that's responsible.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E15 Born Bad Cheyenne follows a thief and killer into a small town where the killer's father is the sheriff. After the sheriff resigns, Cheyenne takes the job. Problems arise when he falls for a girl who is the sister of the killer and daughter of the sheriff.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Savage On his way to Nevada, Adam rides up on some Indians wanting to harm a white woman they believe is a mountain spirit. They escape but Adam is wounded. The woman nurses him back to health but the tribe is on their trail.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E11 Long Gun from Tucson A killer, John Holliver, and his followers come to North Fork looking for revenge. All of the residents are terrified since they ran him out of town five years earlier. Lucas, now acting marshal, realizes that he must face Holliver and his men alone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E12 The High Country Two mountain men, Ambrose and Gorwin, come to the McCain Ranch. Ambrose is captivated by Lucas' rifle but Lucas won't trade it. After Gorwin is killed trying to steal it, the family holds Lucas accountable.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E8 Aged to Perfection The guys saddle up to rope in a renegade heifer before she tears up a neighbor's field. Booger creates a birthday to remember for his 85-year-old grandma, including her first ride in a convertible, a photo shoot and a huge surprise party with a special guest. programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E11 Long Gun from Tucson A killer, John Holliver, and his followers come to North Fork looking for revenge. All of the residents are terrified since they ran him out of town five years earlier. Lucas, now acting marshal, realizes that he must face Holliver and his men alone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E12 The High Country Two mountain men, Ambrose and Gorwin, come to the McCain Ranch. Ambrose is captivated by Lucas' rifle but Lucas won't trade it. After Gorwin is killed trying to steal it, the family holds Lucas accountable.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E1 Big Deal The guys are back in the saddle on The Cowboy Way! Their dreams of making it big have finally arrived with a million-dollar business opportunity, but only if they can come up with half the cash. While the cowboys struggle with how to raise the money, Bubba is torn if he should ask his father-in-law for help. Booger teaches Matthew to be a real cowboy and gives him his first pony! But when Jaclyn misses this big milestone, she questions if her demanding job is keeping her from her family. And finally, Cody's mission to teach kids about the importance of ranching leads him to take on the Cattlemen's Association. How far will he go to make his point?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E2 New Sheriff in Town It's back to basics on The Cowboy Way as the guys work to rotate cattle off a lightning-struck field to fresh grass, but the routine wrangle suddenly heads south as the herd scatters, jumping and taking down part of a fence. Kaley wonders about finances and if she should find work, while Bubba invests in a starter herd for daughter Andie's Cowgirl College Fund. Jaclyn rushes to prepare for Matthew's 4th birthday party and anxiously waits for news after a job interview. Booger's parents have a special birthday surprise for Matthew. As the Cattlemen's Association Ambassador, Cody gets a call from a local farmer and meets their autistic son Tristan. Misty gives Cody an idea how to share the cowboy way lifestyle with this special boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E7 Yellow Bird Yellow Bird is a white woman who was abducted as a child by Apaches and raised as one of their own. Her father, a wealthy Texan, finds her and wants her to return home. She agrees, but only if she can marry Captain Parmenter in the process.

programme.title: The Ballot of Corporal Agarn
programme.desc: Two mayoral candidates from Agarn's hometown of Passaic, New Jersey, travel to Fort Courage to get his vote. With the election tied, each candidate needs Agarn's absentee ballot to win. O'Rourke schemes on a way to make Agarn's decision pay off.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E9 Law Comes to No Man's Land Marshal Chris Madsen helps newly appointed judge John Buford bring law and order to Oklahoma's Panhandle in an area known as No Man's Land. After escorting a wagon train of prisoners to Beaver City, they set up their first courthouse inside a saloon.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E12 The Battle of Stone Corral When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history. After taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E5 Bill Hamilton: The Last Mountain Man Coming of age on the frontier, young Bill Hamilton joins Old Bill Williams on an epic adventure during the final days of the fur trade. The last true mountain man, Hamilton's courage is tested when he faces an epic showdown with Bannock warriors.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Play's the Thing Cody joins a troupe of traveling actors, unaware that the group's members are Confederates who are plotting to assassinate U.S. General Fremont. When the riders discover the truth, they ride to Fort Laramie to save Fremont from getting murdered.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Brand While looking for his missing friend, Cheyenne tries to help a troubled young man responsible for caring for his younger siblings. He soon finds out that the man has committed a serious crime that is unfortunately associated with his missing friend.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E17 Decision at Gunsight In repayment for a debt owed him, Cheyenne receives the deed worth $3000 to a livery stable in Gunsight. However, Cheyenne discovers the truth when he learns of weekly payment to the Gerrard Gang is part of the deal.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E12 Silent Thunder Angry at the way a young deaf woman is treated by her father, Little Joe decides to teach her sign language so they can communicate better. However, his plan backfires when she falls in love with him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E13 A Friend in Need A man named Carl Avery kidnaps Mark and demands a $5,000 ransom for his safe return. Lucas mortgages his ranch to a longtime friend for the money. When Lucas delivers the ransom, he discovers his friend is part of the disturbing kidnapping plot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E14 Skull Lucas and Mark are separated on a hunting trip. During his search, Lucas enters Skull Ranch, a headquarters for outlaws. The gang forces him to help break out two members from jail. Lucas has no choice after he learns they've captured Mark as well.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E15 The Princess Lucas and Mark find a young woman named Jennifer and her ill brother, Charles, hiding in their barn. Doc Burrage treats the boy for measles and they take refuge at the McCain Ranch, but soon Lucas learns that she may be a runaway princess from Europe.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E16 Gunfire Infamous outlaw Charlie Gordo is in the North Fork Jail waiting for the U.S. Marshal to take him to Yuma for hanging. Micah learns that the lawman is dead, and Gordo's gang is arriving soon. Micah, Lucas, and others defend the jail from the gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E16 Gunfire Infamous outlaw Charlie Gordo is in the North Fork Jail waiting for the U.S. Marshal to take him to Yuma for hanging. Micah learns that the lawman is dead, and Gordo's gang is arriving soon. Micah, Lucas, and others defend the jail from the gang.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: These guys can wrangle any bull, but can they tame a wild bulldozer? In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys decide to build a new barn for a local rancher but it's man versus machine when Bubba's dozer breaks a pipeline, releasing a torrent of water. Jaclyn admits to her boss she's been looking for a job closer to home, then worries it might get her fired altogether. Will her family have to survive on one income? Cody decides to write a book about the cowboy way of life, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew. The cowboys struggle to get the barn raised in time to process the first shipment of the herd and might have to call in some favors to do it.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E4 Keep on Chuckin' It's The Cowboy Way's first road trip ever! Bubba, Cody and Booger cut loose and head north to enter a big chuck wagon race. But they quickly discover this race is not for amateurs. Loose wagon wheels, knee-deep mud and professional-grade competition raise both the stakes, and their concerns. Will the guys risk life and limb to race and win? And while the cowboys are away, a surprise shipment of cattle comes in days early and their wives must jump into action. But this drop off is anything but routine when Kaley and Misty discover one heifer has an infection that could threaten the entire herd.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E8 Did Your Father Come from Ireland? While Sergeant O'Rourke is away buying horses, his father, Morgan O'Rourke, visits from Ireland. He decides to take over his son's duties and get Fort Courage into tip-top shape. However, he creates havoc at the fort and with the Hekawi Tribe.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E9 For Whom the Bugle Tolls A colonel with a bugler obsession visits Fort Courage to inspect the fort's bugler. O'Rourke tries to distract the visiting colonel as Dobbs, Fort Courage's bugler, is easily the worst in the army. The troops try to cover up Dobbs' lack of talent.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl's partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious Bandit Queen. In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E6 John Coffee Hays: A Texas Legend A Tennessee native, John Coffee Hays heads to the frontier of Texas in the 1830s and signs on as an early member of the Texas Rangers. In 1844, Hays becomes a legend when he leads a small band of rangers in a desperate fight with the Comanche.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E12 Judgement Day Still feeling the effects of Hezekiah Horn's death, Cody seeks guidance from a self-proclaimed preacher named Gideon Poole. Cody discovers that Poole is a bounty hunter and that he is after Teaspoon for dropped charges from 16 years ago.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Spanish Grant Cheyenne rescues a baby from the wreckage of a stagecoach after an attack causes it to crash. He learns that the infant could be in danger when he discovers that the baby is now the heir to a large parcel of land after the murder of the landowner.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E19 Hard Bargain Cheyenne finds himself in the middle of a bank robbery. Once he's deputized, he goes on the hunt for the robber. After getting badly injured in a bear trap and rescued by the robber, he tries to help the man come clean.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Ape Hoss becomes friends with a man named Arnie. Arnie doesn't realize his own strength and has never learned to control his temper. When a local saloon girl toys with his affections, Arnie becomes dangerous.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E17 The Quiet Fear Jake Striker buys Brice Hornsby's farm after moving to North Fork. Townspeople befriend Jake's pretty daughter, Abbey, who is deaf and cannot speak. Problems arise when a trail bum attacks her and blames the hired hand. Lucas must find the truth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E18 Sporting Chance Englishman Jeremy Pennebroke arrives in North Fork and announces he has come to kill Lucas McCain with his custom-made rifle. He believes if he guns Lucas down, he will earn respect and a reputation. Ironically, Lucas later defends Pennebroke.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E19 A Young Man's Fancy A pretty young girl named Sally Walker arrives on stagecoach in North Fork to visit her aunt Milly. When Mark sees her beauty, he falls in love with Sally instantly. However, she has her eyes on a boy from her past, Bruce Henry, who owns a ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E20 The Man from Salinas Lucas is acting deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. When the North Fork Bank is robbed, Lucas shoots and critically wounds Rudy Gray. Problems arise when a man posing as Gray's brother arrives in town.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: These guys can wrangle any bull, but can they tame a wild bulldozer? In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys decide to build a new barn for a local rancher but it's man versus machine when Bubba's dozer breaks a pipeline, releasing a torrent of water. Jaclyn admits to her boss she's been looking for a job closer to home, then worries it might get her fired altogether. Will her family have to survive on one income? Cody decides to write a book about the cowboy way of life, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew. The cowboys struggle to get the barn raised in time to process the first shipment of the herd and might have to call in some favors to do it.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E4 Keep on Chuckin' It's The Cowboy Way's first road trip ever! Bubba, Cody and Booger cut loose and head north to enter a big chuck wagon race. But they quickly discover this race is not for amateurs. Loose wagon wheels, knee-deep mud and professional-grade competition raise both the stakes, and their concerns. Will the guys risk life and limb to race and win? And while the cowboys are away, a surprise shipment of cattle comes in days early and their wives must jump into action. But this drop off is anything but routine when Kaley and Misty discover one heifer has an infection that could threaten the entire herd.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E8 Did Your Father Come from Ireland? While Sergeant O'Rourke is away buying horses, his father, Morgan O'Rourke, visits from Ireland. He decides to take over his son's duties and get Fort Courage into tip-top shape. However, he creates havoc at the fort and with the Hekawi Tribe.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E9 For Whom the Bugle Tolls A colonel with a bugler obsession visits Fort Courage to inspect the fort's bugler. O'Rourke tries to distract the visiting colonel as Dobbs, Fort Courage's bugler, is easily the worst in the army. The troops try to cover up Dobbs' lack of talent.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl's partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious Bandit Queen. In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E6 John Coffee Hays: A Texas Legend A Tennessee native, John Coffee Hays heads to the frontier of Texas in the 1830s and signs on as an early member of the Texas Rangers. In 1844, Hays becomes a legend when he leads a small band of rangers in a desperate fight with the Comanche.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E19 A Young Man's Fancy A pretty young girl named Sally Walker arrives on stagecoach in North Fork to visit her aunt Milly. When Mark sees her beauty, he falls in love with Sally instantly. However, she has her eyes on a boy from her past, Bruce Henry, who owns a ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E20 The Man from Salinas Lucas is acting deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. When the North Fork Bank is robbed, Lucas shoots and critically wounds Rudy Gray. Problems arise when a man posing as Gray's brother arrives in town.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: Booger goes back to school! On this episode of The Cowboy Way, the cowboys visit the Montgomery Stockyard to research cattle prices and Booger gets bitten by the auctioneering bug. Will his auctioneering classes pay off? Back at the ranch, the guys catch heat from a neighbor when their herd escapes into his field, and a rebellious heifer takes them on one heck of a ride. Misty's brother-in-law, Chip, stops by and gives Cody an earful that his feeding pasture has turned to dirt. And when the cattle stock market takes a nosedive, the cowboys' million-dollar business partner calls the gang into his office for a tough talk.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: The cowboys head west to Louisiana in this episode of The Cowboy Way! The boys hit the road to find the perfect bull for their herd, if Booger's backseat antics don't drive them all crazy first. They discover a cowboy candy store where a famous saddle maker fits Bubba's horse for a custom saddle. Cody gets challenged to a roping contest by some teenagers. And when they accidentally find themselves in the fanciest restaurant in town, the guys test their cowboy palate with fine French cuisine. Escargot anyone? Back home Jaclyn and Kaley try hot yoga for their first and maybe last time, and Misty takes a shine to modeling.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E10 Miss Parmenter Captain Wilton Parmenter's equally clumsy sister, Daphne, visits Fort Courage. She is on a mission to find a husband and soon sets her sights on Dobbs the bugler. In the process, she creates havoc for the F Troop while attempting to marry Dobbs.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E11 La Dolce Courage An Italian man, Emilio Barberini, and his beautiful daughter, Gina, visit the F Troop at Fort Courage. Her beauty attracts the attention of every man, but her hot-headed suitor is pursuing her and swears vengeance on anyone who even glances her way.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Great Train Robbery Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country's greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance's former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it's obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Legend of the Blue-Eyed Apache When eleven-year-old Herman Lehmann is torn away from his frontier home by an Apache raiding party, he must adapt in order to survive. He soon forgets the life he unwillingly left behind and is adopted by an Apache family. For close to a decade, he lives as a Native American, learning their language and customs. Eventually, he even joins the same type of raiding party that separated him from his family. Though the years pass by, Herman's mother never gives up hope that she will be reunited with her son. One day, she hears a rumor of a blue-eyed Apache now living on a reservation. Could this be her long-lost son? Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Herman's mother to uncover the real story of the blue-eyed Apache.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E7 John Mullan: Roadbuilder of the West Young Army officer John Mullan heads west to help establish an important wagon route through the Northern Rockies. But, before he can build his road, Mullan must survive the hardships of the frontier and a dangerous encounter with Yakima warriors.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Peacemakers Jimmy falls for Alice, who is a member of a religious group called The Peacemakers. Jimmy defends the members who want to settle and build a church. However, the hostile townspeople are against their plans to use the land.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E20 The Broken Pledge When accusations arise that Chief Sitting Bull's son killed a miner, Cheyenne meets with him in an attempt to keep the peace. However, when journalist Fay Kirby pushes her way onto the reservation for an interview, she creates an Indian uprising.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E1 Incident at Indian Springs A schoolmaster claims that he killed a bank robber. The townspeople soon celebrate his hero status. However, Cheyenne steps in when the dead criminal's brothers come to town for revenge against the schoolmaster and the school.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Blood Line Todd Grayson arrives in town and is told that Ben Cartwright had killed his father. Ben shot Luke Grayson in self-defense, but Todd won't accept the truth. He wants to avenge his father by killing Ben.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E21 Two Ounces of Tin A gunman named Tip Corey, whose father was allegedly murdered in North Fork, rides into town and threatens to kill Marshal Micah Torrance. Corey gives Micah an ultimatum: take his badge off or he will end his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E22 Deadly Image A local rancher, who claims to be an eyewitness, accuses Lucas of murder. Townspeople are shocked until Earl Bantry, who looks like Lucas' twin, arrives in North Fork. Bantry, a ruthless criminal, threatens Mark and goes on a rampage against Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E23 The Debt While Marshal Micah Torrance is transporting a prisoner to his execution, he meets Lucas and Mark on the trail. When Mark reocognizes the convict is the same man who saved his life three years earlier, he disobeys his father and helps him escape.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E24 Tinhorn Mark and Milly are shocked that Lucas has taken up gambling. However, they don't know that a good friend is in danger of losing his farm to a professional gambler and has asked Lucas to help. Lucas goes undercover to get to the bottom of things.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: Booger goes back to school! On this episode of The Cowboy Way, the cowboys visit the Montgomery Stockyard to research cattle prices and Booger gets bitten by the auctioneering bug. programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E24 Tinhorn Mark and Milly are shocked that Lucas has taken up gambling. However, they don't know that a good friend is in danger of losing his farm to a professional gambler and has asked Lucas to help. Lucas goes undercover to get to the bottom of things.

programme.title: Black Fox
programme.desc: A former slave and his white blood brother have moved their families from the Carolinas to Texas. When the Civil War begins, their settlement is left unprotected from hostile Indian tribes and the former slave may be the only hope for peace.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: Legends of the Stagecoach
programme.desc: A marvel of engineering, the iconic stagecoach becomes indispensable when Americans settle the West. As stagecoaches and their heroic drivers navigate perilous trails to transport passengers and valuables, they are easy targets for lawless bandits.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Real Lone Star Ranger When young Texas Ranger Ira Aten is having trouble hunting down a ruthless outlaw, he enlists the help of John Hughes, an aloof rancher with an uncanny talent for tracking bad guys. The two men form an unlikely and unexpected bond while traversing the dusty path toward justice. With Hughes' guidance, Aten finally catches up to the outlaw and ends his reign of terror. Along the way, Hughes decides to become a Ranger himself and transforms from loner to lawman. Hughes' adventure with Aten is just the first chapter of a storied career that inspires the popular novel, The Lone Star Ranger. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Aten years later to uncover the real story of the Lone Star Ranger and separate the truth from the fiction.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E6 Bass Reeves: Trailblazing Lawman After escaping the bonds of slavery, Bass Reeves takes refuge among the indigenous people of The Indian Territory, where he is welcomed into their culture. When the Civil War ends, his new-found tracking skills and fluency in native languages lead to his appointment as the first Black Deputy U.S. Marshal west of the Mississippi River. Though he faces discrimination from his peers, Reeves earns their respect when he accepts Judge Isaac Parker's daunting order to hunt down one of the most ruthless killers in The Indian Territory and bring him back dead or alive. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Judge Parker to learn more about the amazing career of Bass Reeves, who goes on to arrest 3,000 felons, kill 14 men in self-defense, and complete 32 years of service without being wounded.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E7 Daniel Boone: Hero of Kentucky After frontiersman Daniel Boone forges paths across the Appalachian Mountains and into the newly discovered lands of Kentucky, he founds the settlement of Boonesborough, which quickly becomes one of the most important outposts on colonial America's frontier. But this westward expansion comes at a price. Despite agreements made with the powerful Cherokee nation, conflict between the settlers and natives soon rages like wildfire. For Boone, the strife becomes intensely personal when his daughter and two other young women are abducted by Hanging Maw, a fearsome Cherokee chief. In a desperate chase, Boone pursues Hanging Maw's warriors and their captives through untamed wilderness, with his daughter's life hanging in the balance.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Bringing global investors everything you need to know as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Bringing global investors everything you need to know as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight With Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: The definitive guide for global news audiences to get the complete picture on the story of the day, through probing interviews and nuanced conversations.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa, linking the market drivers from overnight in the U.S. and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep-dive analysis of the top businesses.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: "The Opening Trade" explores things to know as markets open across Europe; analysis that isn't available anywhere else, a break-down of the biggest stories of the day and top guests who have skin in the game.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with guests about global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen

programme.title: Camp Woodward
programme.desc: For most children, summer camp is a time of singing songs by the fire, creating gimp bracelets in arts and crafts, and munching on s'mores. For a special breed of camper, however, it's the season for practicing a 180 G-Turn or mastering a 50/50 grind. "Camp Woodward" follows young daredevils-in-training into the Pennsylvania Dutch countryside, where action-sports counselors and visiting guest professionals help turn these skateboarding and BMX students into the Tony Hawks and Ryan Nyquists of tomorrow.

programme.title: The Adventures of Danny & the Dingo
programme.desc: Professional snowboarder Danny Kass, winner of two Olympic silver medals and even more Winter X Games bling, teams up with Australian colleague Luke "the Dingo" Trembath for a rollicking sports travel series. If there's fresh powder and a steep incline, chances are these two fun-loving guys and their entourage are speeding there in their customized RV, eagerly awaiting the chance to display their talents. While the emphasis is on snowboarding, the energetic hosts also dabble in any other extreme sport that may come their way, as well as the usual off-hour, juvenile high jinks.

programme.title: D-Day the Sixth of June
programme.desc: (1956) Wartime romance set against the background of the D-Day landings, starring Robert Taylor and Dana Wynter. A married American officer embarks on an affair with English nurse.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a drifter who arrives in a small border town and tangles with a group of villains after helping a wealthy young Mexican, played by Manuel Rojas.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers
programme.desc: (1956) Sci-fi thriller. Hugh Marlowe stars as a scientist who discovers Earth is threatened by a fleet of flying saucers bent on global conquest. With special effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: (1999) Action thriller starring Sean Connery as Robert 'Mac' MacDougal, one of the world's finest art thieves, and Catherine Zeta-Jones as the insurance company agent out to trap him.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: A Most Wanted Man
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller with Philip Seymour Hoffman. The arrival of a refugee in Hamburg sparks a flurry of intelligence activity. Is he an asylum seeker or a terrorist? Strong language/violence.

programme.title: Like a Boss
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy with Tiffany Haddish and Rose Byrne. When two best friends find their beauty business in dire financial difficulty, they turn to a scary CEO for help.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: (1965) Thriller. Sidney Poitier plays a photojournalist aboard a destroyer whose commander's obsessive hunt for a Soviet sub could plunge the world into nuclear war.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express
programme.desc: (1965) Second World War adventure. Frank Sinatra stars as the leader of Allied prisoners of war attempting to slip the clutches of their Italian captors. Co-starring Trevor Howard.

programme.title: The Old Man and the Gun
programme.desc: (2018) Crime biopic. Robert Redford stars as charming 74-year-old robber Forrest Tucker. He's still robbing banks when he falls for farmer Jewel (Sissy Spacek). But the cops still want him.

programme.title: Heat
programme.desc: (1995) Al Pacino and Robert De Niro star in Michael Mann's crime thriller. A cop sets out to track down a career criminal and his gang of armed robbers. Violence/strong language.

programme.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
programme.desc: (2018) Crime thriller with Jeff Bridges, Jon Hamm, Dakota Johnson and Chris Hemsworth. Shifty strangers collide in a sleazy-but-glamorous deserted motel with its own buried secrets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: (1954) Medieval action-adventure starring Tony Curtis and Janet Leigh. When a peasant discovers his true lineage, he sets out to woo his noble sweetheart and avenge his father's murder.

programme.title: The Spoilers
programme.desc: (1955) Western. Anne Baxter, Jeff Chandler and Rory Calhoun star in a tale of fortune-seeking and treachery on the untamed Alaskan frontier.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: (1958) Brooding western starring Joan Collins and Gregory Peck. A man hunts down the four escaped prisoners who he believes are responsible for the murder of his wife.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: (1957) Second World War thriller. Robert Mitchum stars as the captain of a US destroyer in the North Atlantic hunting down a German U-boat and its world-weary captain, Curt Jurgens.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: (1985) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. To free his kidnapped daughter, an ex US commando must agree to assassinate a South American president. But he's not as pliant as he seems...

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: (2013) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker. A small-town sheriff and his inexperienced staff take on a drug cartel boss who's fleeing to Mexico.

programme.title: How to Build a Girl
programme.desc: (2019) Caitlin Moran's coming-of-age comedy based on her own experiences of trying to make it as a music journo in London. Cool people are the worst. Strong language/sex/self-harm.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: How Green Was My Valley
programme.desc: (1941) Walter Pidgeon, Maureen O'Hara and Roddy McDowall star in John Ford's multi-Oscar-winning period drama set in the mining communities of the South Wales Valleys of the 19th century.

programme.title: Mary, Queen of Scots
programme.desc: (1971) Vanessa Redgrave stars in a dramatisation of the life of the 16th-century Scottish queen. Glenda Jackson co-stars as her cousin and rival, England's Queen Elizabeth I. Violence.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: (2001) Modern swashbuckling medieval action adventure starring Heath Ledger, Shannyn Sossamon and Paul Bettany. A lowly squire jousts his way to the top, with help from Geoffrey Chaucer.

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: (2018) Action crime thriller sequel. Denzel Washington returns as Robert McCall, who's out for revenge after ruthless killers murder an agency contact who he also considered a friend.

programme.title: The Straight Story
programme.desc: (1999) David Lynch's fact-based drama with Richard Farnsworth. Alvin Straight drives hundreds of miles across the USA on a lawnmower to visit his dying brother - Harry Dean Stanton.

programme.title: Lynch/Oz
programme.desc: (2022) Alexandre O Philippe's unique yet edifying documentary on David Lynch pulls back the curtain to reveal how The Wizard of Oz and Judy Garland influenced the visionary auteur's films.

programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: Tobruk
programme.desc: (1967) World War II thriller. George Peppard, Rock Hudson and Nigel Green lead a daring Allied raid into the heart of the North African desert to destroy the Nazis' fuel dumps.

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: (1960) Adventure with Richard Greene, Peter Cushing and a young Oliver Reed. Can Robin Hood foil the villainous Sheriff of Nottingham's evil plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury?

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure starring Matt Damon and Willem Dafoe. In 11th-century China, Europeans seeking the secret of gunpowder are caught up in a war against alien monsters.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
programme.desc: (2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. Someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.

programme.title: Pixie
programme.desc: (2020) Dark comedy with Olivia Cooke, Alec Baldwin and Colm Meaney. A young woman devises a series of elaborate heists and schemes to fund a new life.
